items.sentence: We stayed in an inexpensive hotel in Boston.
Tom said it didn't look like Mary was tired.
When Tom and I got home, we were very tired.
What Tom and I are doing is perfectly legal.
Tom has a phone, but he doesn't use it much.
Tom had a doctor's appointment this morning.
Tom drowned in his neighbor's swimming pool.
Tom doesn't seem to be as motivated as Mary.
Tom doesn't seem to be as ambitious as Mary.
Tom doesn't always pay attention to details.
Tom didn't seem to be as hungry as Mary was.
Tom could be Canadian, but I don't think so.
Tom isn't in the kitchen or the living room.
Tom isn't a difficult child to take care of.
I brush my teeth at least three times a day.
Tom is usually on time for his appointments.
Tom is going to let Mary borrow his bicycle.
Tom is definitely the right man for the job.
Tom is always early and Mary is always late.
Tom has recently been transferred to Boston.
